data.title: Bust of William Ewart Gladstone
data.meta_description:
Sculpture by John Adams-Acton, circa 1881
	
	William Gladstone became an MP in 1832 and went on to serve as Liberal Prime Minister four times. Born in Liverpool, he was a popular figure in Lancashire and he visited Manchester as a public speaker many times. He was fondly known to his supporters as ‘G.O.M.’ – the Grand Old Man.
	
	A full-length statue of Gladstone was unveiled in Albert Square in 1901.
	
	
	This bust has been temporarily relocated to the Town Hall Extension, in the Council Anteroom.
data.text:
Sculpture by John Adams-Acton, circa 1881

William Gladstone became an MP in 1832 and went on to serve as Liberal Prime Minister four times. Born in Liverpool, he was a popular figure in Lancashire and he visited Manchester as a public speaker many times. He was fondly known to his supporters as ‘G.O.M.’ – the Grand Old Man.

A full-length statue of Gladstone was unveiled in Albert Square in 1901.

This bust has been temporarily relocated to the Town Hall Extension, in the Council Anteroom.
